author: Greg Daugherty
title: Safety Tips for Using Hotel Gym Equipment
text:
The death of Dave Goldberg, the chief executive of SurveyMonkey, in May at a resort gym in Mexico raised some unsettling questions for travelers who like to work out when theyâ€™re on the road: How safe are hotel fitness facilities and their equipment? (Initial news reports suggested that Mr. Goldberg died in a treadmill accident, though later accounts said a heart ailment could have played a role.) And how risky is it to exercise when few people may be around?
Experts say the likelihood of dying, being badly injured or contracting a serious disease as a result of a visit to a hotel gym is rare, but the potential is real. The risks include equipment-related injuries, heart attacks and a constellation of contagions, for which gyms are an ideal breeding ground.
